Key Match Events: Netherlands won by 6 wickets (with 8 balls remaining)
Dipendra Singh Airee's 34-ball 63 took Nepal to the doorstep of victory before Roelof van der Merwe bowled him with four runs needed off three balls and Netherlands sealed a two-run win.
Pre-Game Insights: Netherlands vs Nepal - the one match neither team can afford to lose
Netherlands have a 6-5 T20I record against Nepal overall, and their six meetings in the pandemic and post-pandemic eras have been dead even.

Netherlands may have been here and done it before, while Nepal have only featured in one previous T20 World Cup, but the results they achieved in that tournament - in 2014, when they beat Afghanistan and fell short of a Super 10s spot only by virtue of net run-rate - should tell you that this could be a seriously tight contest.
Michael Levitt earned his first Netherlands call-up last year, at 19, and has gone on to become a key player at the top of the order since his debut this February.
Dipendra Singh Airee, Nepal's highest run-getter in T20Is, has shown his quality against higher-ranked teams too.
With a visa refusal ending Sandeep Lamichhane's potential participation in the World Cup, the question of Lalit Rajbanshi's spin partner becomes highly pertinent.
Dallas was where this World Cup got underway, and it got underway with a bang, as USA chased down 195 with 14 balls remaining.
The threat of rain hangs over the match, though, with Dallas experiencing stormy weather in the lead-up, and there's a 20% chance of precipitation forecast for Tuesday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sompal Kami is the only survivor from Nepal's last appearance at the T20 World Cup in 2014.
Logan van Beek is playing his fifth T20 World Cup, having previously featured in 2014, 2016, 2021 and 2022.
